byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma reported from Kathmandu and Nida Najar reported from New Delhi
byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Nepalese police clash with demonstrators protesting draft of new constitution that includes drawing new provinces, resulting in at least five deaths in Birgunj and Kalaiya; ethnic groups say new divisions dilute their political power.
lead_paragraph: Five members of an ethnic minority were killed by police gunfire during protests over the latest version of a draft constitution.

headline.main: Clashes Over Draft Constitution Kill 5 in Nepal
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Nepal: Five Are Killed in Protests

snippet: Five members of an ethnic minority were killed by police gunfire during protests over the latest version of a draft constitution.
